titles: The excellent comedie of two the moste faithfullest freendes, Damon and Pithias Newly imprinted, as the same was shewed before the Queenes Maiestie, by the Children of her Graces Chappell, except the prologue that is somewhat altered for the proper vse of them that hereafter shall haue occasion to plaie it, either in priuate, or open audience. Made by Maister Edvvards, then beynge Maister of the Children. 1571.
author: Edwards, Richard, 1523?-1566.
publisher: In Fleetelane by [William Williamson for] Richarde Iohnes, and are to be solde at his shop, ioyning to the southwest doore of Paules Churche,
notes: Running title reads: The tragicall commedie of Damon and Pithias.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
